title: Remove K Digits
patternTriggers: Remove digits to minimize number? Use monotonic increasing stack, remove larger digits from left!

approaches.name: Greedy with Stack (Monotonic Increasing)
approaches.intuition: Remove digits from left that are larger than next digit. Use stack to maintain increasing sequence. Remove k largest on left.
approaches.approach: Build monotonic increasing stack. When current digit < stack top, pop (remove larger digit). Continue until k removals done.
steps: While stack not empty AND stack.top > digit AND k_remaining > 0:
If k_remaining > 0: remove last k_remaining digits
Build result from stack, remove leading zeros

complexity.timeExplanation: Each digit pushed/popped at most once
complexity.spaceExplanation: Stack stores up to n digits

approaches.name: Greedy without Explicit Stack
approaches.intuition: Same greedy strategy but use string/array manipulation instead of stack.
approaches.approach: Build result string, backtrack when needed to remove larger digits.
steps: When current < last in result and k > 0:
Handle remaining k and leading zeros

commonMistakes: Not handling remaining k after main loop (need to remove from end)
Not handling edge case: k >= n (return "0")
Comparing characters as strings instead of values
Trying to remove k largest digits globally (should remove from left)
hints: Remove larger digits from left to minimize number
When current digit < stack top: pop stack (remove larger)
After loop, may need to remove more digits from end
Must remove all leading zeros from result
Greedy works: locally optimal (remove larger left digit) = globally optimal
followUp: Maximize number instead of minimize? (Use monotonic decreasing stack)
